name: Erikur Silver-Maned

aspects.high_concept: Nord Merchant and Bane of Mice (Silver)
aspects.trouble: Ambition That Buys Friends and Makes Enemies
other_aspects: Court Influence Built on Favors and Debts

stunts: Silver Tongue: +2 to Rapport when negotiating deals, bargains, or commercial agreements.
Merchant's Memory: +2 to Notice when spotting valuable goods, counterfeit items, or hidden wealth.
Debtor's Leverage: Once per session, call in a favor from a contact in Solitude's merchant or dock community to obtain information or a service.

equipment.special: Merchant ledger, promissory notes, access to Solitude docks

personality_notes.speaking_style: Smooth, confident, always calculating. Flatters those useful to him; dismissive of those who are not. Uses business language even in personal conversation.
motivations: Expand his trading network across Skyrim and into Cyrodiil
Secure court influence through financial leverage
Protect his shipping interests at Solitude's docks
fears: Financial ruin or loss of court standing
Someone smarter at negotiation than he is
The civil war disrupting his trade routes
quirks: Subtly appraises everything in a room on entering
Never drinks without first calculating social benefit
Uses diminutives condescendingly with people he considers beneath him

relationships.Elisif the Fair: Uses court access to advance merchant interests; gives gifts to maintain goodwill
relationships.Falk Firebeard: Tense—Falk sees through his flattery and keeps him at arm's length
relationships.Solitude Dockworkers: Employer; treats them as resources rather than people
relationships.Thalmor: Maintains cordial trade relations; some suspect deeper ties
relationships.Player: Sees capable outsiders as potential tools; will hire them for morally ambiguous work

advancement_triggers: Complete a profitable task for him (+2)
setback_triggers: Expose him to Falk or Elisif's scrutiny (-3)

trust_benefits.3: Erikur offers preferential prices and access to rare trade goods
trust_benefits.6: Erikur shares dock contacts, smuggling routes, and lucrative but risky jobs

scene_triggers: Commerce and trade negotiations in Solitude
Court political intrigue at the Blue Palace
notes: Erikur Silver-Maned is one of Solitude's most prominent merchants and a fixture of Elisif's court. He is charming but fundamentally self-serving, and his commercial interests often blur into political manipulation. He is not a villain per se, but his willingness to use people makes him an untrustworthy ally.
gm_notes: Erikur works well as a morally grey quest giver—his jobs pay well but rarely sit cleanly with heroic sensibilities. His Thalmor connections can be hinted at and developed into a subplot. Falk's visible distrust of him is a useful signal to players who pay attention to court dynamics.
